H0.text: where do the phaeacians live in the odyssey. Corcyra

H1.text: where do the phaeacians live in the odyssey. Ithaca

H2.text: where do the phaeacians live in the odyssey. Elis

H3.text: where do the phaeacians live in the odyssey. Scheria

A4.text: Many ancient and modern interpreters favor identification of Scheria with the island of Corfu, which is within 110 km (68 miles) of Ithaca. Thucydides, in his Peloponnesian War, identifies Scheria as Corfu or, with its ancient name, Corcyra.

A5.text: Odysseus however was the king of the majority of the Ionian Islands, not only of Ithaca, but also 'of Cephallenia, Neritum, Crocylea, Aegilips, Same and Zacynthus' so if Scheria was Corfu, it would be surprising that the citizens of one of the Ionian Islands did not know Odysseus. Furthermore, when Odysseus reveals his identity, he says to the nobles: '[â€¦] if I outlive this time of sorrow, I may be counted as your friend, though I live so far away from all of you' indicating that Scheria was far away from Ithaca.
